page.title: 05DARLINGTON WATERWORKS
page.content: Darlington Waterworks pump 150-160 thousand tons of water a day or 286,720,000 pints of water.The water goes through 4 stages - Filtration, Floculation, Coagulation and Chlorination. Each tank holds 68,000 tons of water.Most of the water comes from the River Tees and sometimes the Tyne. Water can be transferred from the Kielder reservoir through tunnels under the mountains. An average house uses about 30 gallons of water per-day .Half of the water is purified the rest is sent to companies like I.C.I.it is called raw water.The new waterworks plant number 1 was opened in 1953 and plant number 2 opened in 1974.The waterworks serve 2,500,000 people.There are 17 men employed,14 manual and 3 staff.They work 8 hour shifts.The most important piece of equipment is the{MEN!
